title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 23 November 2012 - XWiki
content:
<coud> has quit

05:46 <sdumitriu1> has joined #xwiki  
05:46 <xwiki-sources> [xwiki-platform] none pushed 3 new commits to master: http://git.io/\_YFpEA

05:46 <xwiki-sources> xwiki-platform/master 1afcb06 Sergiu Dumitriu: XWIKI-8503: Reimplement form field hints (withTip behavior) based on the HTML5 "placeholder" attribute...

07:08 <polx> has joined #xwiki

08:35 <mrvanes> has joined #xwiki

08:56 <coud> has joined #xwiki  
08:58 <coud> has quit  
08:59 <coud> has joined #xwiki  
09:03 <coud> has quit  
09:04 <coud> has joined #xwiki  
09:05 <vmassol> sdumitriu: thanks for the IE8 fixes!  
09:05 <vmassol> 2 remaining blocks: http://jira.xwiki.org/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?mode=hide&requestId=11892  
09:05 <vmassol> Denis: good morning, will you be able to fix XWIKI-8484 today?  
09:09 <coud> has quit  
09:12 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
09:13 <Denis> vmassol: no really on my planning, and not sure what we really want. Have you read my comment ?  
09:13 <Denis> Good morning :)  
09:15 <vmassol> Denis: I havn't followed the issue but it's set as a blocker for the release and we're behind a lot already  
09:16 <vmassol> I've read your comment  
09:16 <vmassol> and you see we need to write a new migration  
09:16 <vmassol> right?  
09:16 <vmassol> s/see/say  
09:16 <vmassol> so we need to decide how we progress for the release  
09:17 <Denis> no a new migration, but a new feature for migrator maybe  
09:17 <Denis> s/no/not/  
09:17 <vmassol> ok  
09:18 <Denis> in fact the migrator arrive too late  
09:18 <vmassol> so the question is: when could you work on this since it's a blocker for the release? All our hopes rely on you since I'm not who else would be able to work on this :)  
09:19 <vmassol> btw this is new for 4.3 right? It wasn't happening before when migrating to 4.2?  
09:20 <vmassol> ah yes R43000XWIKI6691DataMigration was added in 4.3  
09:21 <Denis> yes, it XWIKI-6691 was already postponed in 3.5 for similar reason  
09:22 <Denis> s/it/and/  
09:24 <Denis> vmassol: what is annoying is that we saw this only after RC1, we are late and I do not like putting new feature at that stage in hurry  
09:26 <sburjan`> I tested this before RC1 but using the old method, and I didn't have it  
09:26 <sburjan`> so either the old migration testing method is not good, or something triggers the issue after RC1  
09:27 <Denis> the old method ?  
09:27 <sburjan`> Denis: yes, the one we were using. By starting another clean container instead of replacing just the war  
09:28 <Denis> I do not see what this could change in this issue  
09:28 <sburjan`> me neither  
09:30 <Denis> note that this issue was not blocking, would it be possible you missed the stacktrace ?  
09:30 <sburjan`> no, it's not possible. not after testing this 5+ times  
09:31 <sburjan`> I didn't say it was blocking or stopping the user from using the wiki. I marked it as a blocker because I always mark failed migrations as blockers because usually a failed migration puts the db in consistent state.  
09:31 <sburjan`> I guess this doesn't happend in this case, but I am not an expert on this field  
09:32 <Denis> stacktrace in the log should be blocker, but I really do not understand why we fail on this only now  
09:32 <sburjan`> me neither  
09:32 <sburjan`> oddly nobody on the lists complained about this, so this must be someting new  
09:36 <Denis> vmassol: concretely, I need to add a new method on HibernateDataMigration interface, similar to the existing one, for getting another liquibase changelog, implement it in the abstract class, upgrade the HibernateMigrationManager to use it, and finally use it in R43000.  
09:37 <Denis> This does not look too hard, I may write the code quickly this morning, but I will not test it deeply, if Sorin could do so, and we agree on this way to go, I start right now  
09:40 <Denis> mmm, based on that new feature, R40000 may be improved as well, but not sure I risk that right now as well  
09:40 <Denis> vmassol: WDTH ?  
09:40 <sburjan`> yes, I can re-test when your commit gets in the packages  
09:43 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:43 <Denis> sburjan`: you will have to check not only migration,  but also initial installation and new wiki, and on all DBs  
09:46 <vmassol> has quit  
09:47 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
09:47 <vmassol> back, reading  
09:49 <vmassol> Denis: sounds good  
09:49 <sburjan`> Denis: depends how much vmassol is giving me  
09:49 <vmassol> well do we have a choice?  
09:49 <vmassol> it's either:  
09:49 <vmassol> 1) we consider this issue not blocking for 4.3 and fix it later on in 4.3.1  
09:50 <vmassol> 2) we fix it  
09:50 <vmassol> do we agree that 1) is not good?  
09:50 <Denis> 3) we revert it  
09:50 <vmassol> ah yes  
09:50 <sburjan`> still, if db is consistent when performing the second restart, we should be pretty safe as far as I understood fom Denis  
09:51 <Denis> sure but there is a weird stacktrace at startup the first time  
09:51 <vmassol> it's http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-6691 right?  
09:51 <Denis> right  
09:51 <sburjan`> anyway, you know better the technical stuff. I am lheading to the office. See you in 40.  
09:51 <vmassol> sdumitriu: you have an opinion since you closed this issue?  
09:53 <vmassol> I'd vote to rollback this issue  
09:53 <vmassol> it's the safest and the issue doesn't seem that importat  
09:53 <vmassol> important  
09:54 <vmassol> maybe it increases performance but the issue doesn't say so  
09:54 <vmassol> if the goal was to increase the performance of the AS then the title is bad  
09:55 <vmassol> indeed it's about performance I think  
09:55 <vmassol> " This is a very serious bug which creates slowness issue on large activity stream."  
09:56 <vmassol> however this can done manually by admins, ludovic provided a XAR for that  
09:56 <tdelafosse> has joined #xwiki  
09:57 <vmassol> ok so here's my take:  
09:57 <vmassol> we give it one more day ie today  
09:58 <vmassol> so Denis try to fix it today and sorin retests  
09:58 <vmassol> and at the end of the day we see where we stand  
09:58 <vmassol> ok?  
09:58 <vmassol> if in the end it's too complex/risky we roll it back on Monday  
09:58 <vmassol> otherwise we release either Monday morning or Monday afternoon  
09:59 <Denis> ok, I try to get something ready before noon, I do not want to do only that today  
09:59 <vmassol> ok  
09:59 <vmassol> thanks Denis!  
09:59 <vmassol> tmortagne: gm, you have a blocker opened, you're fixing it today?  
10:00 <tmortagne> vmassol: which one ? I don't see any blocker assigned to me  
10:00 <tmortagne> checking again  
10:00 <vmassol> see : http://jira.xwiki.org/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?mode=hide&requestId=11892  
10:01 <vmassol> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-8483  
10:02 <tmortagne> vmassol: I was waiting for mflorea to check it  
10:05 <vmassol> in the meantime, devs should work on fixing functional tests and reviewing the translation report: http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/TestReports/TranslationsReport43  
10:07 <tmortagne> I'm currently looking at XALOCALIZATION-22  
10:18 <tmortagne> new workspaces keys are imported, any save was stuck yesterday for along time  
10:30 <tmortagne> starting to look at XWIKI-8483  
10:32 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
10:33 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
10:33 <sburjan> I am back  
10:33 <sburjan> so, vmassol, Denis : what's your conclusion. What are we gonna do ?  
10:33 <vmassol> Denis is working on it  
10:33 <vmassol> see above  
10:33 <coud> has joined #xwiki  
10:35 <vmassol> would be good is someone looked at http://ci.xwiki.org/view/Functional%20Tests/job/xwiki-manager-test-webstandards/ and find out why the DM is triggered for all tests  
10:41 <tmortagne> vmassol: it's not, I fixed it last time already  
10:42 <tmortagne> hmm  
10:42 <tmortagne> that's weirs  
10:42 <tmortagne> I did fixed it  
10:42 <tmortagne> will check what changed this time  
10:44 <coud> has quit  
10:45 <coud> has joined #xwiki  
10:48 <coud> has quit  
10:48 <coud> has joined #xwiki  
10:51 <coud> has quit  
10:51 <coud> has joined #xwiki  
11:01 <tmortagne> vmassol: xwiki-manager-test-webstandards should be ok now, was a 4.4 only thing  
11:04 <coud> has quit  
11:05 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
11:06 <tmortagne> vmassol: most of the failing test in xwiki-manager-test-webstandards-4.3 are fixed AFAIK, not sure why it's not up to date  
11:06 <tmortagne> (most if not all)  
11:07 <tmortagne> forcing some builds  
11:07 <tmortagne> xwiki-manager-4.3 seems very old  
11:07 <tmortagne> looks like it has not been triggered automatically  
11:08 <tmortagne> jenkins conf was wrong  
11:12 <coud> has quit  
11:12 <Slashman> has quit  
11:13 <coud> has joined #xwiki  
11:14 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
11:17 <vmassol> strange I fixed it  
11:17 <vmassol> yesterday  
11:17 <vmassol> ah maybe not, I fixed the functional tests confs  
11:17 <vmassol> (including the xwiki manager tests confs)  
11:18 <vmassol> seems like jvelo made a lot of mistakes in the jenkins job confs….  
11:18 <vmassol> (I fixed 30 errors already)  
11:18 <tmortagne> we need the automatic generation ;)  
11:19 <vmassol> yep  
11:19 <Slashman\_> has joined #xwiki  
11:21 <Slashman> has quit  
11:41 <msmeria> has quit  
11:41 <jvdrean> I just noticed Solr documents are not marked as hidden  
11:42 <sburjan> has quit  
11:45 <coud> has quit  
11:46 <coud> has joined #xwiki  
11:48 <vmassol> jvdrean: could you report it in a jira or ping edy? (or fix it) :)  
11:48 <vmassol> just to make sure it's not forgotten  
11:48 <jvdrean> since Edy is offline I'm gonna fix it  
11:49 <vmassol> ok thanks  
11:50 <Slash\_\_> has joined #xwiki  
11:50 <Slashman\_> has quit  
11:53 <coud> has quit  
11:54 <coud> has joined #xwiki  
11:58 <Slashman\_> has joined #xwiki  
11:58 <Slash\_\_> has quit  
11:59 <coud> has joined #xwiki  
12:00 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
12:03 <coud> has quit  
12:05 <coud> has joined #xwiki  
12:13 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
12:13 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
12:14 <jvelo> vmassol: what jenkins error ?  
12:14 <jvelo> actually I used the script  
12:14 <vmassol> edy's script?  
12:14 <jvelo> yes  
12:14 <vmassol> ahah  
12:14 <vmassol> Enygma`: your fault then :)  
12:14 <jvelo> I guess it's not production ready yet :)  
12:15 <vmassol> there were 2 errors (repeated N times)  
12:15 <jvelo> well, to be honest Edy has put a lot of warnings there  
12:15 <vmassol> 1) wrong branch  
12:15 <vmassol> 2) wrong triggers  
12:15 <jvelo> OK  
12:15 <jvelo> I actually checked a couple of confs, but nothing jumped to my eyes  
12:17 <Enygma`> what did I do?  
12:17 <Enygma`> :)  
12:17 <Enygma`> what went wrong with the jenkins script?  
12:17 <Enygma`> I tested it only on one project and it did the job right  
12:18 <Enygma`> are you talking about the -4.3 jobs that were not having the right branch?  
12:19 <sburjan> starting to test the migrations and db related tests with the jar Denis gave me  
12:19 <sburjan> vmassol: I should be done in 2 hours then you can start the release  
12:19 <vmassol> ok great  
12:23 <Enygma`> jvelo: ?  
12:23 <jvelo> Enygma`: I don't know, vmassol noticed the errors. wrong branch & wrong triggers apparently  
12:24 <vmassol> Enygma`: jvelo was using your script for creating the jenkins jobs ;)  
12:25 <Enygma`> yes, but maybe he did not use the right values for the variables that needed editing, so maybe that`s why the branch name was not properly generated  
12:26 <jvelo> Enygma`: vmassol what branch was it building ?  
12:26 <vmassol> 4.2  
12:26 <jvelo> (I've double check those values)  
12:26 <jvelo> OK  
12:27 <vmassol> the triggers were not there at all though  
12:27 <Enygma`> vmassol: AFAIK, we were relying on Build whenever a snapshot is build, instead of triggers  
12:28 <jvelo> Enygma`: the names of the jobs were right, so the variables must have been correct, no ?  
12:31 <Enygma`> jvelo: I think you`re right... I will have a better look at it when I have some spare time  
12:31 <Enygma`> anyway, thanks for using it for now :)  
12:32 <vmassol> Enygma`: no  
12:32 <vmassol> not for functional tests  
12:33 <Enygma`> vmassol: no what?  
12:33 <vmassol> "AFAIK, we were relying on Build whenever a snapshot is build, instead of triggers"  
12:33 <Enygma`> ah  
12:33 <Enygma`> well, I have noticed that whenever you rename a project, all references to it also get renamed  
12:34 <Enygma`> so any existing triggers should have also updated  
12:34 <vmassol> well  
12:34 <Enygma`> yeah, will see  
12:34 <vmassol> 1) they were lost  
12:34 <vmassol> but  
12:35 <vmassol> 2) even if they had not been lost they have been incorrect  
12:35 <vmassol> because they need to refer to 4.3 jobs  
12:35 <vmassol> s/they have/they would have  
12:35 <Enygma`> well, that`s what I just said... when you rename the 4.2 job to 4.3, the 4.2 tests will also have their triggers updated from 4.2 to 4.3  
12:36 <Enygma`> at least that is how it was supposed to work, don`t know what went wrong  
12:43 <coud> has quit  
12:44 <coud> has joined #xwiki  
12:48 <Enygma`> vmassol: the translations should be done now. RalucaM translated the missing french ones.  
12:51 <coud> has quit  
12:51 <coud> has joined #xwiki  
12:54 <coud> has quit  
12:55 <coud> has joined #xwiki  
12:59 <coud> has quit  
13:00 <coud> has joined #xwiki  
13:02 <coud> has quit  
13:21 <silviar> has joined #xwiki  
13:37 <vmassol> Enygma`: ok thanks, I'l try doing an import of the translations  
13:47 <vmassol> guys on the "update translation" steps here: http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleasePlans/ReleasePlanHelp#HSetupyouridentity there's this warning about adding branch info in git/config  
13:47 <vmassol> does anyone know what it's for?  
13:58 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
13:58 <Enygma`> maybe the reason is that our scripts do generic git pull/push commands  
13:58 <vmassol> now I've added the info but I have a hard time committing htem  
13:58 <Enygma`> that do not specify branches  
13:58 <Enygma`> and to fix that, you need to have branches specified in the configs  
13:59 <Enygma`> (btw, the release scripts should also specify the the branches)  
14:03 <jvelo> has quit  
14:03 <vmassol> hmm  
14:03 <vmassol> I ran release-translations.sh and  
14:03 <vmassol> 1) it didn't download any translation  
14:04 <vmassol> but  
14:04 <vmassol> 2) in platform it made a change locally:  
14:04 <vmassol>              <!-- FIXME: A new 'sendMessageFromTemplate' method was added before the 4.2 release and then removed only  
14:04 <vmassol> -                 from master (4.3-SNAPSHOT). We need to decide what we do with this method. -->  
14:04 <vmassol> +                 from master (4.4-SNAPSHOT). We need to decide what we do with this method. -->  
14:04 <vmassol> (in the pom.xml)  
14:04 <Enygma`> it also fetches the sources  
14:04 <vmassol> apparently it didn't reach do\_all()  
14:05 <vmassol> I don't understand a single thing about what happened :)  
14:05 <vmassol> I'm not used to work with git modules I guess  
14:06 <Enygma`> doesn`t have anything to do with modules  
14:06 <vmassol> when I do a git status in xwiki-trunks/ I get:  
14:06 <vmassol> # modified:   xwiki-enterprise (new commits)  
14:06 <vmassol> now when I go in xwiki-enterprise and do a git status I get:  
14:06 <Enygma`> ignore what xwiki-trunks says  
14:06 <vmassol> hudsonagent@ks365275:~/releases/xwiki-trunks/xwiki-enterprise$ git status  
14:06 <vmassol> # On branch stable-4.3.x  
14:06 <vmassol> nothing to commit (working directory clean)  
14:06 <tmortagne> vmassol: git status only look at the current repository  
14:07 <tmortagne> sub modules are totally independent  
14:07 <vmassol> why does it say there are commits?  
14:07 <tmortagne> don't expect to be some kind of svn externals  
14:07 <tmortagne> it's far from it  
14:07 <Enygma`> basically xwiki-trunks has old HEAD id`s for its modules.  
14:08 <Enygma`> xwiki-trunks should be regularly updated, but nobody generally cares bout that and directly fetches the sources of each module independently  
14:08 <vmassol> apparently I've udpated it  
14:08 <vmassol> see my last commit on the list  
14:08 <Slashman\_> has joined #xwiki  
14:08 <tmortagne> IMO we should simply get rid of xwiki-trunks  
14:09 <vmassol> big +1  
14:09 <vmassol> I've never used it locally  
14:09 <tmortagne> its useless  
14:09 <vmassol> now can someone understand why in xwiki-platform I have this change?  
14:09 <vmassol> https://gist.github.com/4135548  
14:10 <tmortagne> vmassol: different ending line I guess  
14:10 <vmassol> nope  
14:10 <vmassol> something  
14:10 <vmassol> replaced 4.3-SNAPSHOT by 4.4-SNASPHTOT  
14:11 <tmortagne> ha did not seen it  
14:11 <vmassol> why would I get this when running update-translations.sh  
14:11 <vmassol> it does some cleanup but I don't get why I'm getting some local changes  
14:11 <tmortagne> update-translations.sh does not touch any pom.xml AFAIK  
14:11 <Enygma`> that is weird indeed  
14:11 <tmortagne> you sure you did not had it before ?  
14:12 <vmassol> I can't be 100% sure  
14:12 <vmassol> ok I'm going to discard it  
14:12 <Enygma`> yes, someone (jvelo ?) might have left it there  
14:12 <vmassol> BUT  
14:12 <vmassol> I thought that the cleanup was doing just that  
14:12 <tmortagne> what cleanup ?  
14:13 <vmassol> https://gist.github.com/4135562  
14:13 <vmassol> when you call release-translations.sh  
14:13 <vmassol> it calls this method:  
14:13 <vmassol>     check\_clean xwiki-enterprise  
14:13 <vmassol>     check\_clean xwiki-manager  
14:13 <vmassol>     check\_clean xwiki-platform  
14:13 <vmassol> git reset --hard &&  
14:13 <tmortagne> it just check if you have changes  
14:13 <vmassol> should remove everything  
14:14 <tmortagne> yes  
14:14 <vmassol> so why do I still have changes?  
14:14 <tmortagne> but don't you get the error first ?  
14:14 <vmassol> I don't get any error at all  
14:14 <tmortagne> "Please do something with these changes first."  
14:14 <tmortagne> the probleme is that it's executed in xwiki-trunks  
14:15 <vmassol> ah yes I do now  
14:15 <vmassol> hmm  
14:15 <vmassol> ok removing  
14:15 <tmortagne> "git reset --hard" in xwiki-trunks will not touch the sub modules  
14:15 <tmortagne> like most git commands  
14:15 <tmortagne> which is what is very bad about sub module IMO  
14:16 <vmassol> ok it seems to be processing now  
14:16 <vmassol> downloading stuff  
14:16 <vmassol> I'm still wondering about the warning in the release plan  
14:16 <vmassol> http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleasePlans/ReleasePlanHelp#HSetupyouridentity  
14:17 <vmassol> what do we do about it?  
14:20 <Enygma`> if jvelo did not have any problems, then I doubt you will
